RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Mestre em Engenharia Biomdica pela Universidade do Vale do Paraba UNIVAP (2006), graduao em Cincias Contbeis pela Universidade de Taubat (1992), Especializao em Administrao Financeira e Auditoria pelo INPG (1993), graduao em Licenciatura em Matemtica pela Universidade Braz Cubas (1999), Especializao em Matemtica pela FAENQUIL (2001), Finanas e Controladoria no INPG (2008), Especializao em Engenharia Aeronutica pela UNITAU (2010), Engenharia de Produo (2016). Experincia como professor na rea de Matemtica por 16 anos na rede pblica, professor de Contabilidade Empresarial, Contabilidade Bsica , Anlise de Balanos e Contabilidade Gerencial, Clculo I, Clculo II, Introduo ao Clculo, Clculo para Aeronutica pela FATEC e Estatstica, Matemtica Financeira, Matemtica Aplicada pela UNIP Universidade Paulista, ETEP Faculdades. Atualmente trabalho na FATEC Faculdade de Tecnologia de So Jos dos Campos.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: bachelor's at licenciatura em matematica from universidade braz cubas (1999), bachelor's at Ciencias contabeis from universidade de taubate (1992) and master's at bioengenharia from universidade do vale do paraiba (2006). Has experience in Mathematics, focusing on Mathematics

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Light Dependent Resistance as a Sensor in Spectroscopy Setups Using Pulsed Light and Compared with Electret Microphones
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Light Dependent Resistance as a Sensor in Spectroscopy Setups Using Pulsed Light and Compared with Electret Microphones

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Light-dependent resistances (LDR) are cheap light sensors. A less known lightdetector is the electret microphone, whose electret membrane functions as a perfectabsorber, but only detects pulsed light. The aim of this study was to analyze the use of aLDR and an electret microphone as a light sensor in an optical spectroscopy system usingpulsed light. A photoacoustic spectroscopy setup was used, substituting the photoacousticchamber by the light sensor proposed. The absorption spectra of two different liquids wereanalyzed. The results obtained allow the recommendation of the LDR as the first choice inthe construction of cheap homemade pulsed light spectroscopy systems.
